Summary: Dashboard - Left sidebar visible
Description: Verify left sidebar is visible and displays all menu items
Precondition:
1. User is authenticated
2. Application is running
3. Browser is open
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /dashboard
2. Check left sidebar
3. Verify all menu items are visible
Expected Results:
1. Sidebar is visible on left side
2. All menu items display: Dashboard, Products, Code Library, Quality Measures, Value Sets, Code Mappings, Analytics, Settings, Support, Users
3. Icons are visible for each menu item
Acceptance Criteria: Sidebar is visible and contains all navigation items

Summary: Dashboard - Active menu item highlighted
Description: Verify Dashboard menu item is highlighted when on dashboard page
Precondition:
1. User is authenticated
2. Application is running
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /dashboard
2. Check sidebar active state
3. Verify Dashboard menu item styling
Expected Results:
1. 'Dashboard' menu item is highlighted/active
2. Other menu items are not highlighted
3. Active state is visually distinct
Acceptance Criteria: Active state clearly indicates current page

Test Steps:

4. Observe result
Expected Results:

Expected Results:

Description: Verify Code Types statistic card shows correct count

2. User is authenticated

2. Locate Code Types statistic card
3. Verify displayed count
Expected Results:
1. Code Types card is visible
2. Shows '3' code types
3. Lists types: CPT, HCPCS, ICD-10

Summary: Code Library - Search by exact code value
Description: Verify search functionality filters by exact code value
Precondition:
1. Database has 58 codes loaded
2. Code '83036' exists in database
3. User is on /codes page
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Type '83036' in search field
3. Wait 500ms for results
4. Verify filtered results
Expected Results:
1. Results filter to show only codes matching '83036'
2. Code '83036' is displayed with type 'CPT'
3. Description contains 'Hemoglobin A1c'
4. Results appear within 500ms
Acceptance Criteria: Search filters by exact code match

Summary: Code Library - Search by partial description
Description: Verify search functionality filters by description text
Precondition:
1. Database has codes with 'hemoglobin' in description
2. User is on /codes page
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Type 'hemoglobin' in search field
3. Wait 500ms for results
4. Verify filtered results
Expected Results:
1. Results show codes with 'hemoglobin' in description
2. Search is case-insensitive
3. Results appear within 500ms

Summary: Code Library - Clear search returns all codes
Description: Verify clearing search shows all codes again
Precondition:
1. Database has 58 codes
2. User has entered search term
3. Results are filtered
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Type '83036' in search field
3. Wait for filtered results
4. Clear search input
5. Verify all codes return
Expected Results:
1. All 58 codes are displayed
2. Pagination shows 'Page 1 of 3'
3. Statistics update to full counts

Summary: Code Library - Search is case-insensitive
Description: Verify search works regardless of case
Precondition:
1. Database has codes
2. User is on /codes page
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Type 'HEMOGLOBIN' (uppercase) in search field
3. Wait for results
4. Clear search
5. Type 'hemoglobin' (lowercase) in search field
6. Wait for results
7. Compare results
Expected Results:
1. Uppercase search returns results
2. Lowercase search returns results
3. Both searches return the same results

Summary: Code Library - Search debounce prevents excessive API calls
Description: Verify search waits 300ms before executing query
Precondition:
1. User is on /codes page
2. Browser DevTools Network tab is open
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Open DevTools Network tab
3. Type 'hemo' quickly in search field
4. Observe network requests
5. Verify timing
Expected Results:
1. Search waits 300ms after typing stops
2. Only one API call is made after typing stops
3. No API calls during typing

Summary: Code Library - No results found message
Description: Verify 'No Codes Found' message displays for invalid search
Precondition:
1. Database has 58 codes
2. User is on /codes page
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Type 'ZZZZZ' in search field
3. Wait for results
4. Verify message
Expected Results:
1. 'No Codes Found' message is displayed
2. Suggestion to adjust search is shown
3. No codes are displayed in table

Summary: Code Library - Refresh button reloads data
Description: Verify Refresh button reloads code list
Precondition:
1. User is on /codes page
2. Code list is displayed
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Click 'Refresh' button
3. Observe loading indicator
4. Verify data reloads
Expected Results:
1. Loading indicator displays
2. Code list reloads from API
3. Statistics update
4. No console errors

Summary: Code Library - Next page button navigates forward
Description: Verify Next button navigates to next page
Precondition:
1. Database has 58 codes (3 pages)
2. User is on page 1
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes
2. Verify on page 1 (shows 'Page 1 of 3')
3. Click 'Next' button
4. Verify navigation
Expected Results:
1. Navigates to page 2
2. Shows next 20 codes
3. Pagination shows 'Page 2 of 3'
4. Previous button becomes enabled

Summary: Code Library - Previous page button navigates backward
Description: Verify Previous button navigates to previous page
Precondition:
1. Database has 58 codes (3 pages)
2. User is on page 2
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes page 2
2. Verify on page 2 (shows 'Page 2 of 3')
3. Click 'Previous' button
4. Verify navigation
Expected Results:
1. Navigates to page 1
2. Shows first 20 codes
3. Pagination shows 'Page 1 of 3'
4. Previous button becomes disabled

Summary: Code Library - Previous button disabled on first page
Description: Verify Previous button is disabled on first page
Precondition: 1. User is on /codes page 1
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /codes page 1
2. Locate Previous button
3. Verify button state
Expected Results:
1. Previous button is disabled
2. Button is visually grayed out
3. Clicking has no effect
Acceptance Criteria: Previous button disabled on first page

Summary: Quality Measures - View measure overview tab

2. Measure name is displayed

Summary: Code Mappings - Create Benefit Mapping button opens dialog
Description: Verify Create Mapping button opens creation dialog
Precondition:

2. User has create permissions

3. Verify dialog opens
Expected Results:

2. Dialog displays all required fields
3. Dialog opens within 300ms
Acceptance Criteria: Creation dialog opens on button click

Summary: Code Mappings - Create valid benefit mapping
Description: Verify creating a valid benefit mapping succeeds
Precondition:
1. User is in mapping creation dialog
2. Database has codes and benefit segments
Test Steps:
1. Open mapping creation dialog
2. Select code from dropdown
3. Select benefit segment
4. Enter copay '25.00'
5. Enter coinsurance '20%'
6. Set deductible applies to 'Yes'
7. Set priority to '1'
8. Click 'Create'
9. Verify result
Expected Results:
1. Mapping is created successfully
2. Success message displays
3. Mapping appears in list
4. Dialog closes
Acceptance Criteria: Mapping is created and appears in list

Summary: Code Mappings - Validate required fields in mapping creation
Description: Verify validation prevents empty required fields
Precondition: 1. User is in mapping creation dialog
Test Steps:
1. Open mapping creation dialog
2. Leave code field empty
3. Try to click 'Create'
4. Verify validation
Expected Results:
1. 'Code is required' error displays
2. Dialog does not close
3. Form does not submit

Summary: Code Mappings - Detect mapping conflicts
Description: Verify conflict detection for duplicate code-benefit pairs
Precondition:
1. Mapping exists for code '83036' to 'Primary Care'
2. User is in mapping creation dialog
Test Steps:
1. Open mapping creation dialog
2. Select code '83036'
3. Select benefit 'Primary Care'
4. Try to create
5. Verify conflict warning
Expected Results:
1. Conflict warning displays
2. Options to update or cancel are shown
3. Duplicate mapping is not created

Summary: Code Mappings - Cancel mapping creation
Description: Verify Cancel button discards changes
Precondition:
1. User is in mapping creation dialog
2. User has entered some data
Test Steps:
1. Open mapping creation dialog
2. Enter some data in fields
3. Click 'Cancel'
4. Verify result
Expected Results:
1. Dialog closes
2. No mapping is created
3. Data is discarded

2. Select codes (some with existing mappings)

Summary: Code Mappings - View Equivalency Mappings tab
Description: Verify Equivalency Mappings tab displays correctly
Precondition:
1. User is authenticated
2. Database has 3 equivalencies
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /mappings
2. Click 'Equivalency Mappings' tab
3. View content
Expected Results:
1. Equivalency Mappings tab is active
2. Statistics cards display
3. Equivalencies table displays

Summary: Code Mappings - Equivalency statistics display
Description: Verify Equivalency statistics cards show correct data
Precondition:
1. Database has 3 equivalencies
2. User is on Equivalency Mappings tab
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /mappings
2. Click Equivalency Mappings tab
3. Verify statistics cards
Expected Results:
1. Total Equivalencies card shows '3'
2. Coverage Rate card displays correct percentage
3. Avg Confidence card displays correct percentage
4. Top Category card displays most common category

Summary: Code Mappings - Create Equivalency button opens dialog
Description: Verify Create Equivalency button opens creation dialog
Precondition: 1. User is on Equivalency Mappings tab
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /mappings
2. Click Equivalency Mappings tab
3. Click 'Create Equivalency' button
4. Verify dialog opens
Expected Results:
1. Creation dialog opens
2. All required fields are visible
3. Dialog opens within 300ms

Summary: Code Mappings - Create valid equivalency
Description: Verify creating a valid equivalency succeeds
Precondition:
1. User is in equivalency creation dialog
2. Database has codes
Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency creation dialog
2. Enter name 'HbA1c Test Equivalency'
3. Enter description
4. Select category 'Laboratory'
5. Select source 'Manual'
6. Set confidence to 100%
7. Search for source code '83036' (CPT)
8. Select source code
9. Search for target code '4548-4' (LOINC)
10. Select target code
11. Select relationship 'Exact Match'
12. Set bidirectional to 'Yes'
13. Click 'Create'
14. Verify result
Expected Results:
1. Equivalency is created successfully
2. Success message displays
3. Equivalency appears in table
4. Dialog closes

Summary: Code Mappings - Search for codes in equivalency dialog
Description: Verify code search displays suggestions in dialog
Precondition: 1. User is in equivalency creation dialog
Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency creation dialog
2. Type '83036' in source code field
3. Verify suggestions dropdown
Expected Results:
1. Code suggestions dropdown appears
2. Shows '83036 - Hemoglobin A1c (CPT)'
3. Can select from dropdown

Summary: Code Mappings - Adjust confidence slider
Description: Verify confidence slider adjusts value 0-100%
Precondition: 1. User is in equivalency creation dialog
Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency creation dialog
2. Locate confidence slider
3. Drag slider
4. Verify value changes
Expected Results:
1. Slider value changes from 0-100%
2. Percentage badge updates
3. Slider is smooth

Summary: Code Mappings - Validate required fields in equivalency creation
Description: Verify validation prevents empty required fields
Precondition: 1. User is in equivalency creation dialog
Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency creation dialog
2. Leave name field empty
3. Try to click 'Create'
4. Verify validation
Expected Results:
1. 'Name is required' error displays
2. Dialog does not close
3. Form does not submit

Summary: Code Mappings - Cancel equivalency creation
Description: Verify Cancel button discards changes
Precondition:
1. User is in equivalency creation dialog
2. User has entered some data
Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency creation dialog
2. Enter some data
3. Click 'Cancel'
4. Verify result
Expected Results:
1. Dialog closes
2. No equivalency is created
3. Data is discarded

Summary: Code Mappings - View equivalency in table
Description: Verify equivalencies display correctly in table
Precondition:
1. Database has 3 equivalencies
2. User is on Equivalency Mappings tab
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /mappings
2. Click Equivalency Mappings tab
3. View equivalencies table
Expected Results:
1. 3 rows are displayed
2. Each row shows name, category badge, source, confidence %, mapping count
3. Category badge is color-coded

Summary: Code Mappings - Open equivalency details modal
Description: Verify clicking eye icon opens details modal
Precondition:
1. Database has equivalencies
2. User is on Equivalency Mappings tab
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /mappings
2. Click Equivalency Mappings tab
3. Click eye icon on an equivalency

1. Details modal opens
2. Modal displays equivalency name as title
3. Modal opens within 300ms

Summary: Code Mappings - View equivalency details
Description: Verify equivalency details display all properties
Precondition: 1. Equivalency details modal is open
Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency details modal
2. View content
3. Verify all properties display
Expected Results:
1. Description is displayed
2. Category badge is displayed
3. Source is displayed
4. Confidence percentage is displayed
5. All code mappings are displayed

Summary: Code Mappings - View code mappings in equivalency details
Description: Verify code mappings display as source → target pairs
Precondition:
1. Equivalency details modal is open
2. Equivalency has code mappings
Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency details modal
2. View mappings section
3. Verify display
Expected Results:
1. Source code → target code pairs are displayed
2. Code type badges (CPT, LOINC) display correctly
3. Relationship badge (Exact, Broader, etc.) displays correctly
4. Mappings are clearly formatted

Summary: Code Mappings - Close equivalency details modal

Test Steps:
1. Open equivalency details modal
2. Click 'Close' button
3. Verify modal closes
4. Open modal again
5. Click X button
6. Verify modal closes
Expected Results:
1. Close button closes modal
2. X button closes modal
3. Returns to equivalencies table

Summary: Error Handling - Server error displays helpful message

2. Verify error message
Expected Results:
1. 'Server error' message is displayed
2. User-friendly explanation is shown

Summary: Error Handling - No console errors on any page
Description: Verify browser console has no red errors
Precondition:
1. User is authenticated
2. Browser DevTools Console is open
Test Steps:
1. Open DevTools Console
2. Navigate through all pages: Dashboard, Code Library, Quality Measures, Value Sets, Code Mappings, Products, Analytics
3. Check console for red errors
Expected Results:
1. No red console errors on any page
2. Browser console is clean
3. Only warnings or info messages (if any)
Acceptance Criteria: No red console errors on any page
